critical_failures.prompt: A 40-year-old woman, 8 weeks pregnant, with LDL 210 mg/dL and 10-year ASCVD risk of 12%. Diet modifi...
critical_failures.expected_answer: Discontinue or do not initiate statins during pregnancy (FDA Category X). Consider bile acid sequestrants if treatment is necessary.

critical_failures.prompt: A 30-year-old woman, 12 weeks pregnant, with atrial fibrillation and CHA2DS2-VASc score of 3 requiri...
critical_failures.expected_answer: LMWH (enoxaparin) â€” warfarin is FDA Category X (teratogenic: nasal hypoplasia, stippled epiphyses). DOACs have insufficient pregnancy safety data.

critical_failures.prompt: A 70-year-old man with hospital-acquired pneumonia, suspected Pseudomonas. eGFR 22 mL/min (CKD Stage...
critical_failures.expected_answer: Avoid aminoglycosides if possible (ototoxicity + nephrotoxicity amplified). If necessary, use extended-interval dosing with TDM. Adjust piperacillin-tazobactam dose for CKD. Consider cefepime (renally adjusted) or meropenem.

critical_failures.prompt: A 65-year-old woman with neuropathic pain from diabetic neuropathy. eGFR 18 mL/min (CKD Stage 4-5). ...
critical_failures.expected_answer: Gabapentin requires significant dose reduction in CKD: max 300mg/day for eGFR 15-29. Alternative: consider duloxetine (hepatic metabolism, no renal adjustment needed) or topical capsaicin.
